results.title: Lifeline to Adelaide
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and John Kingsford-Smith
results.brief_description: Adelaide’s water supply is boosted by the 50 miles of piping from Mannum on the Murray. With the lowest rainfall of any Australian capital, heavy industry expanding each year, and a rapid increase in homes and population, the six reservoirs in the Lofty Ranges are unable to supply enough water for Adelaide’s needs. An extra supply of water is pumped through 72 inch concrete pipes to dams near the city.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and John Kingsford-Smith

results.title: Lifeclimb
results.creator_credit: Stan Zundell, Stan Zundell Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: A documentary in which 64 year old Stan Zundell describes the manner in which he has faced the difficulties and challenges of aging. Shows how he continually challenges himself with rigorous physical activity, increasing his abilities as he struggles to achieve his goals.

results.title: Lifeboat
results.brief_description: A small band of men and women survive the sinking of an Allied freighter by a German U-boat, only to find themselves dependent upon a Nazi they rescue from the sea into their lifeboat. With the help of a John Steinbeck script and bravura performances from a cast that includes Tallulah Bankhead, Walter Slezak and Hume Cronyn, Hitchcock transforms the cramped confines of the lifeboat into a bigger-than-life battlefield of good and evil. “Lifeboat” is a tour de force only the Master of Suspense - Alfred Hitchcock could have created.

results.title: Lifeblood of the city
results.creator_credit: Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: How Melbourne has always depended on the Yarra for its existence. The expanding city has drawn upon the Yarra and its tributaries, culminating in the development of the head-waters of the Yarra itself. The climax is the building of the Upper Yarra Dam, shown in detail. The film uses old prints to illustrate past development of Melbourne, with emphasis on its water supply. Material filmed at all stages of the ten years of building the Upper Yarra Dam presents a full picture of how a large rock and earth dam is built. Concludes witht he opening of the reservoir by Sir Dallas Brookes (26th November 1957). Commentary by Geoff Raymond.

results.title: Life: What a Ride
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” Cancer returns to my body. My breasts are gone, breasts that nurtured four children and gave pleasure. In their place a tapestry of the scars and wounds of the last 12 years.”

results.title: Life. Be in it
results.creator_credit: Victorian Department of Youth, Sport and Recreation
results.brief_description: Phillip Adams conceived and developed the “Life Be In It” advertising campaign aimed at encouraging the community to become more involved in physical activity and recreation. Includes examples of television commercials featuring characters such as Norm, the average all-round armchair sportsman.

results.title: Life with junior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
A typical day in the life of a ten-year-old, presenting such common problems as the acceptance of a new brother and the refusal to eat. Emphasises the anxieties of parents over guiding their children in today’s world, and explains ways in which to cope with behaviour problems.

results.title: Life with grandpa
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
The problems of old age as they affect people in the United States - achievements of medical science in forestalling disease, controlling dangerous ailments earlier in life; with a longer life expectancy, an increasing population of old people; ways of combating prejudices against employing old persons. Some notable personalities of advanced years including Sir Winston Churchill, Dorothy Dix and George Bernard Shaw.

results.title: Life with baby
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
How children grow mentally and physically has been studied during the past 35 years by a group of specialists working under the direction of Dr Arnold Gesell at the Yale University Clinic of Child Development. They have been able to establish definite standards of development for children up to six years of age. Many of these findings are illustrated in this film. Non-technical in character, the film aims at a better understanding of the young child by adults and older children.

results.title: Life will never be the same
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Amanda Jurisic and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘You don’t need to jump on a plane, or go to a theme park or stay at a five star hotel to experience the beautiful things in life.’ Amanda Jurisic remembers her father’s legacy : a sense of adventure and a love of travel. The values he taught her have stayed with her, and inspired her to travel the world.
